0.42.text:
Tonight on Realtree Global Hunting, we're back
in South Africa

3.51.text:
in the bushveld with Benjamin Bulldog .357
Big Bore air rifle.

8.08.text: The all new Big Bore rifle from Crosman

10.14.text: has taken Duiker, Springbok and 3 Warhogs.

13.96.text: But tonight we're looking for Impala.

56.04.text:
So far the Benjamin Bulldogs .357 has
impressed the guys here at Team Wild

61.04.text:
and experienced big game hunting Gavin
Ingram of Nduna Hunting Safaris.

66.24.text:
The all new Big Bore hunting air rifle
from Crosman

69.28.text:
has certainly lived up to the hype and
staked its claim to the Big Bore throne.

76.52.text:
However, hunting big game with an air
rifle isn't easy.

83.14.text:
range is a critical factor when hunting big
game with a air gun, the Bulldog certainly

89.70.text:
but the nozzle designed bullet doesn't
carry the same energy as semi

95.08.text: this means I've really got to get close

97.27.text: and into a good position, close enough for the Bulldog nozzle combo to do the business.

103.26.text: And as the game gets bigger

105.86.text:
needs to be perfect, you simply can't
afford to pull a shot

110.26.text:
or miss the vitals on bigger game when
you're hunting with an air rifle.

114.20.text:
This is the challenge of big game air gun
hunting

117.68.text: and I'm loving every minute of it.

128.88.text: It's a windy morning in the hills of Nduna,

130.68.text:
and the hunting here today could bring
in additional challenge

134.56.text:
when the wind is up the animals become
nervous

139.38.text: Ordinary they use there acute sense of hearing and smell to detect

143.90.text:
However, when the wind is noisily
swirling through the trees

147.24.text:
senses are less affected. In conditions
like this

155.04.text:
we've not been out long when Gavin spot
something.

160.14.text: Gavin can see movement through the bushveld,

162.18.text: but getting into position may not be easy.

170.52.text: We head up and over the top using the tree line as cover.

175.32.text:
Despite the wind blowing it's still a
beautiful day.

179.58.text: However the game remains in thicker cover

184.94.text: We spot a group of red hartebeest

186.38.text: as they make a break for the top of the hill,

190.34.text:
but we're too far out for a shot and there's
very little cover between them and us.

211.80.text: An unsettled herd of red hartebeest can spook any animals in the vicinity,

215.63.text: so we decided to head on.

221.17.text:
into the bottom. There's less
interference from the wind down here

224.33.text: and the animals will hopefully be at ease.

228.86.text:
crisscross the entire state an offer the
game safe passage for one plane

258.02.text: As we merge onto the bottom,

259.34.text:
Gavin has spotted a herd of Impala
feeding just over the browl of this hill.

266.98.text:
there's very little cover again
between us them.

271.60.text:
We're 100 yards out and have no way of
getting closer from here.

276.20.text: We hit the deck crawl around them.

281.13.text:
There's a tree line to the right of the herd and
we should have just enough covered

307.58.text:
The herd are now on high alert and don't
look happy.

314.59.text: I get a good ram in my crossheirs, but

318.16.text: before I can take my shot the herd make a run for it.

326.98.text:
After a frustrating morning in the high
winds and then over

329.92.text:
an hour calling into position, 70 yards
out from the Impala

336.82.text: But we've been too eager and moved in too quickly.

340.52.text: Our lack of patience has cost us and the herd has made a run for it.

354.68.text:
This is the challenge a Big Bore
airgun hunting.

358.04.text: You're stalking must be perfect so that you can get into

360.81.text:
a good position and then your shot
placement most also be spot-on

366.90.text: Airgun hunting is much less forgiving then with a full bore rifle,

374.22.text:
but we will be back out in the bushveld
again tomorrow.
